subtasks: Drive the combine harvester onto the field.
Adjust the combine harvester's speed.
Monitor the combine harvester's operation.
Navigate the combine harvester through the crop rows.
Approach the combine harvester where crops are being unloaded.
Position the truck under the combine harvester's discharge spout.
Secure the truck's doors or gates.
Watch for the combine harvester operator's indication to start unloading.
Receive the crops as the combine discharges them.
Push or guide the crops into the truck bed.
Avoid getting hands or clothing caught in moving parts.
Identify a bale that has been ejected from a baler.
Walk towards the bale to retrieve it.
Lift the bale off the unloading platform.
Carry the bale to a designated stacking area.
Place the bale on the stack, ensuring it does not slip.
Walk through the rows of crops.
Bent down to inspect plants for weeds.
Dig out weeds by hand, using gloves to avoid injury.
Dispose of weeds properly, not stepping on or damaging crops.
Walk across the field with a fertilizer spreader.
Ensure the spreader is appropriately calibrated.
Broadcast fertilizer onto the soil surface.
Walk in straight lines to maintain even coverage.
Use a planter to open furrows in the soil.
Drop seeds into the furrows at the correct spacing.
Cover the seeds with soil, using the planter's closing wheels.
Check rows for proper planting depth and spacing.
Inspect the sprinkler system for any breaks or clogs.
Test sprinklers to ensurethey are rotating properly.
Adjust the system's timer if necessary to meet current weather conditions.
Climb ladders to access upper branches of apple trees.
Shake apple trees to dislodge ripe apples.
Collect fallen apples from the ground.
Place apples into containers or bags.
Identify overgrown vines that need removal.
Dig around the base of the vine to loosen the root system.
Pull the vine out of the ground, ensuring not to damage surrounding crops.
Walk along the field's edges to locate drainage ditches.
Clear debris from the ditches to ensure proper water flow.
Inspect pipes or culverts for blockages.
Don protective clothing and gloves before handling chemicals.
Load a backpack sprayer or hose connexion system.
Apply pesticides to the crop according to the label instructions.
Ensure even coverage without overspray.
Start the mower and ignite the engine.
Drive the mower through the field at a consistent speed.
Operate the mower's height adjustment levers as needed.
Turn the mower around at the end of a pass.
Adjust the spreader to the appropriate setting for the type of fertilizer.
Pull the spreader behind a tractor, maintaining a steady speed.
Keep an eye on the spread pattern to ensure even distribution.
Prepare the seed corn by checking its quality.
Load the corn into the planter hopper.
Operate the disk openers to open the soil.
Drop corn seeds at the correct depth and spacing.
Locate the damaged area on the pipe.
Use tools to dig around the pipe if necessary.
Cut the pipe to remove the damaged section.
Join the ends of the pipe using appropriate fittings.
Test the repair by running water through the pipe.
Approach a livestock animal, such as a cow or sheep.
Apply a numbered tag to the ear or another visible location.
Confirm the tag is securely fastened.

tasks.task: Adjust the height of the plow for tillage.
subtasks: Identify the plow toolbar or第三节犁架.
Lower or raise the plow blades to the desired depth.
Lock the plow in position.
Guide the baler through the field, collecting hay.
Secure the crop into the baler.
Unload bales when full and transport them to storage.

tasks.task: Plan irrigation schedule based on the field’s moisture level.
subtasks: Use a soil moisture meter or scout the field visually.
Determine the need for irrigation based on crop stage.
Schedule irrigation events, considering weather forecasts.

tasks.task: Detect a broken plastic covering protecting a young crop.
subtasks: Walk through the rows of young plants.
Look for any tears or gaps in the plastic cover.
Mark or repair the damaged area to prevent pests or the elements.
Position the grain wagon under the spout of the combine harvester.
Load grain into the wagon using the auger.
Transfer grain from the wagon to storage, if necessary.
Attach the cultivator to a tractor.
Set the depth and width of cultivation.
Drive through the field to disturb the soil and control weeds.
Use a drone or ground-based sensor to capture images of crops.
Analyze the images for nutrient deficiencies, pests, or other issues.
Record data on soil moisture levels using probes.
Mark the areas needing sampling.
Use a soil auger to extract samples at the appropriate depth.
Store samples in labeled containers.

tasks.task: Use a propane tank to burn weeds.
subtasks: Approach the area with the propane sprayer.
Apply a directed burn to the weeds, being careful not to damage surrounding crops.
Monitor the burn to ensure it only affects the targeted weeds.
Approach the pig enclosure or feeding area.
Distribute feed to the pigs, ensuring even distribution.
Check for any pigs that may have health issues or require extra feed.
Open the beehive box.
Check for signs of swarm activity or disease.
Remove any dead bees or pests.
Verify that the queen is present and healthy.
Retrieve a bale from the field.
Approach the cow and attach the milking machine.
Release the milklet to begin milking.
Monitor milking progress and adjust the machine as needed.
Collect the milk when milking is complete.
Swing a scythe or sickle to cut the hay.
Store the cut hay properly to prevent spoilage.
Conduct regular inspections for mold or other issues.
Check the rain gauge for the recorded amount.
Compare the data with the irrigation schedule to adjust as necessary.
Assemble the seeder components.
Load the seed box with the appropriate seed variety.
Set the depth and spacing on the drill.
Secure the drill onto the drawbar of the tractor.
Choose the right fertilizer for the garden type.
Apply the fertilizer manually, spreading it evenly over the garden.
Water the garden to help the fertilizer dissolve and be absorbed.

tasks.task: Hitch a trailer to a tractor.
subtasks: Position the trailer in front of the tractor.
Lift the trailer tongue/lift plate with the front wheels raised.
Insert the trailer hitch pin into the receiver and secure with a safety clip.
Cut the seed potatoes into pieces, each with at least one eye.
Plant the pieces at the correct depth in rows.
Cover the planted pieces with soil to protect them from frost.

tasks.task: Drive a stake in the ground.
subtasks: Locate the spot where the stake needs to be placed.
Hold the stake vertically and hit the top of it with a mallet or hammer until it is secure.

tasks.task: Remove weeds from a garden by hand.
subtasks: Kneel or squat near the garden row.
Grip weeds near the base and pull them out, taking care not to damage plants.
Dispose of pulled weeds, ensuring they are not accidentally replanted.
Use a planter to open trenches in the soil.
Drop cotton seeds into the trenches, spacing them according to guidelines.
Cover the seeds with soil, using the planter’s closing wheels.
Monitor the planted area for consistency in planting.
Use a spade to cut into the soil, turning over clumps or debris.
Push the spade into the ground and lever the soil over.
Continue spading until the desired area is tilled.
Walk through the corn field after the seedlings have emerged.
Apply fertilizer around the base of the corn plants, taking care not to burn the leaves.
Distribute the fertilizer evenly in a strip alongside the rows.
Identify the damaged section of the fence.
Remove any broken slats or posts.
Replace missing components with matching parts.
Test the fence’s stability and reattach any posts that were loose.
Clear the garden bed of weeds and debris.
Add compost or fertilizer to enrich the soil.
Till the soil to a fine texture.
Plant seeds or seedlings in rows or blocks.
Monitor the temperature and airflow settings inside the dryer.
Add wet grain as it is harvested and the grain bin fills.
Check for any overheating or malfunctions.
Check the fuel and oil levels before use.
Operate the equipment for trimming, mowing, or planting.
Walk through all areas of the farm to be assessed.
Note the value of crops, livestock, and equipment.
Calculate the assessed value for tax purposes.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Weed the perimeter of the field.
subtasks: Walk along the edges of the field, pulling up weeds by hand.
Inspect the fields from a distance to identify any pest signs.
Walk through the fields to check specific plants for insect or disease damage.
Note any affected areas for treatment or management.

tasks.task: Check irrigation system during dry spells.
subtasks: Monitor the irrigation system's water levels.
Ensure that the system is not overwatering and leads to drainage issues.
Identify branches that are crossing or near the ground.
Use pruning shears or saws to remove or trim the branches.
Disinfect tools between cuts to prevent disease spread.

tasks.task: Gather eggs from a chicken coop.
subtasks: Open the entrance of the chicken coop.
Collect eggs from the nesting boxes.
Place the eggs in a basket or container.
Clean the coop floor before closing it up.
Collect manure from livestock shelters.
Mix the manure with straw or other carbon-rich material.
Layer the materials to start the composting process.
Load the seeder with rice seed.
Set the proper planting depth and spacing.
Plow the field and then run the rice seeder in straight rows.
Attach the sprayer to a tractor or be mounted on the vehicle.
Drive through the field, spraying seaweed extract over the crops.
Monitor the coverage to ensure all areas are treated.

tasks.task: Collect crops for harvest by hand.
subtasks: Select mature crops from the field.
Bend down to pick individual plants or clusters.
Place the collected items into a basket or bag.
Ensure no damage occurs to the crops during collection.
Open the beehives early in the growing season.
Transfer bees to a portable hive if moving to a new field.
Monitor hive activity to ensure sufficient pollination.
Attach the subsoiling toolbar to a tractor.
Operate the subsoilers at the correct depth, usually deeper than primary tillage.
Monitor the operation to ensure proper cutting of compaction layers.

tasks.task: Operate an army rod for pest control.
subtasks: Dip the rod into a pesticide solution.
Insert the rod into the soil near plants, covering the area with pesticide.
Dispose of the army rod properly to avoid contamination.
Unbox all parts of the new baler.
Follow the manufacturer's instructions to correctly assemble the baler.
Test the assembled baler by operating it with a tractor.

tasks.task: Operate a blower or vac truck.
subtasks: Connect the equipment to a grain bin or pile.
Start the engine and adjust the speed.
Direct the air or vacuum to remove loose grain, debris, or residue.
Check the silo's liquid level gauge for grain or grain moisture.
Adjust the grain outflow or aeration settings as necessary.
Properly place the reducer in the entrance of the hive.
Ensure the reducer size is appropriate for the season.

tasks.task: Set up a new irrigation system.
subtasks: Plan the layout of the system based on field boundaries.
Dig trenches for the pipes if laying the system underground.
Install the irrigation pipes and connect to the water source.

tasks.task: Load a horse onto a trailer.
subtasks: Approach the horse calmly and lead it to the trailer.
Secure the horse into a tie-down or cross-ties inside the trailer.
Close and secure the trailer doors.
Depos. t the grass or legume seed into the ground.
Cover the seed appropriately and tamp it down.

tasks.task: Identify a bale with the correct tag for sale.
subtasks: Walk the rows of bales and check each tag.
Select bales that meet quality standards (e.g., size, moisture content) for sale.
Stack the chosen bales together for easy loading.
Pinpoint the location where the pipe is damaged.
Dig around the pipe to expose it, taking care not to damage nearby pipes or structures.
Replace the damaged section with a new pipe or fitting.
Reconnect the new pipe and test it for leaks.

tasks.task: Operate an excavator for field drainage.
subtasks: Raise the excavator bucket and navigate to the drainage area.
Dig trenches for the drainage tiles at the proper depth.
Install the tiles and backfill with a filter material.
Assess the health and well-being of all animals on the farm.
Note any injured or ill animals needing veterinary attention.

tasks.task: Seed a corn field in rows.
subtasks: Align the planter machine to the row markers.
Cut netting material to the right length for binding bales.
Wrap the bales with the net to secure them for stacking and handling.
Identify which animal groups need fresh feed.
Distribute new feed to the animals, adjusting for any special needs.

tasks.task: Apply a chemical treatment to remove pests from a field.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate pesticide for the specific pest.
Prepare the chemical mixture according to the label directions.
Apply the treatment via ground equipment or air.
Monitor the field for effectiveness and re-treat if necessary.
Drive a tractor equipped with a rope or flag to mark strips on the field.
Guide the crusher or disking tool over the marked stripes to prepare the soil.
